recentResearch.title: Low-Resource African Languages and Cultures
recentResearch.description: This research focuses on improving culturally aligned Large Language Models (LLMs) for low-resource African languages. The goal is to develop scalable data collection methods and create benchmarks for better model evaluation.

recentAchievements.title: Speaker – TAHAKOM Developer Day, Riyadh
recentAchievements.description: Presented on Model Context Protocol (MCP), exploring its challenges like prompt injection and context expansion and showcasing how ACI.dev is tackling them head-on. Shared work with the brilliant AI talent in Saudi Arabia and contributed to their flourishing AI ecosystem.

recentAchievements.title: Speaker – San Francisco Tech Week Immersion
recentAchievements.description: Spent a week immersed in the San Francisco tech scene, presenting at Hack Night hosted by Weaviate on how ACI.dev is transforming the tool-calling space for AI agents. Also attended engineering night hosted by Dust and participated in windsurf build night by AI collective, experiencing rapid tech adoption and the culture of building in SF.
insights: Culture of Building in SF ecosystem

recentAchievements.title: 2nd Place – Europe's Largest AI Agent Hackathon
recentAchievements.description: Built Table 42, an AI-powered restaurant concierge that converts social media engagement into real bookings by integrating with social platforms and personalizing the discovery-to-reservation journey.

recentAchievements.title: 3rd Place – Portia AI Track, Encode AI London Hackathon
recentAchievements.description: Developed SNTC (Say NO TO CORRUPTION), an AI-Powered risk assessment tool. The system identifies corruption risks through political exposure screening, sanctions checks, adverse media analysis, and jurisdictional risk evaluation.

recentAchievements.title: Winner – HackLBS 2025, London Business School
recentAchievements.description: Created Gastronaut, a conversational AI audio bot with automated table management to address manual reservation inefficiencies in Southeast Asian restaurants. The solution modernizes bookings, reduces human error, and enhances customer experience.

blogPosts.title: Building Culturally Aware AI: Lessons from African Language Models
blogPosts.excerpt: My research journey into developing AI systems that understand and respect cultural nuances, particularly for low-resource African languages.
blogPosts.content:
Working on culturally aligned Large Language Models for African languages has been one of the most challenging and rewarding aspects of my research. The conventional approach to AI development often overlooks the rich linguistic and cultural diversity that exists beyond Western contexts.

Through my research, I've discovered that building truly inclusive AI requires more than just translation. It demands a deep understanding of cultural context, social norms, and the unique ways different communities express ideas and emotions.

One of the key challenges we face is the scarcity of high-quality training data for low-resource languages. This isn't just a technical problem—it's a representation problem. When AI systems are trained predominantly on Western content, they inevitably reflect Western perspectives and biases.

Our approach focuses on developing scalable data collection methods that respect local communities and their intellectual property. We're not just extracting data; we're building partnerships with local linguists, educators, and community leaders.

The goal isn't to replace existing languages with AI-generated content, but to create tools that help preserve, celebrate, and promote linguistic diversity in our increasingly digital world.
blogPosts.author: Jamie Ogundiran
